alert.note: Alert for Hunterdon; Somerset (New Jersey) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 22 at 10:00AM EDT until August 22 at 1:45PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 145 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON FOR NORTHERN SOMERSET AND EAST CENTRAL HUNTERDON COUNTIES... At 1000 AM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain across the warned area. Between 1 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. The expected rainfall rate is 2 to 4 inches in 1 hour. Additional rainfall amounts of 3 to 4 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets, and underpasses as well as other drainage and low lying areas. Some locations that may experience flash flooding include... Somerville, Bridgewater, Peapack And Gladstone, Lebanon, Far Hills, White House Station, Martinsville, Basking Ridge, Bernardsville, and Raritan. This includes the following highways... Interstate 78 in New Jersey between mile markers 22 and 37. Interstate 287 in New Jersey between mile markers 15 and 28. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED EXPECTED RAINFALL RATE...2-4 INCHES IN 1 HOUR
info.instruction: Turn around...don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
